H0.text: Joint is the location near which bursitis, the inflammation of a bursa, occurs.

H1.text: Brain stem is the structure near which bursitis, the inflammation of a bursa, occurs.

H2.text: Lung is the structure near which bursitis, the inflammation of a bursa, occurs.

H3.text: Muscle is the structure near which bursitis is the inflammation of a bursa.

A4.text: Bursitis commonly affects superficial bursae. These include the subacromial, prepatellar, retrocalcaneal, and pes anserinus bursae of the shoulder, knee, heel and shin, etc.

A5.text: Shoulders, elbows and knees are the most commonly affected.
